alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:20PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry, south central Clay and northwestern Early Counties through 400 PM EDT/300 PM CDT/... At 320 PM EDT/220 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Abbeville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Headland, Blakely, Columbia, Centerville, Newville, Haleburg, Shorterville, Barnes, Tumbleton, Hardwickburg, Capps, Grandberry Crossroads, Hayes, Rock Hill, Murphy Station, Headland Municipal A/P, Dancey, Miller and Willis Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
